article: I'd been proud that I'd never lost my cellphone until my husband Jack got a call one evening. We went to visit a friend in hospital last year. When Jack's _ rang, it was my mother calling from my _ . She asked if I had _ my mobile. I checked my purse. It was _ ! I used Jack's phone to call my number. Then a boy, whom I'll call Rhys, _ it. I found your phone! he said, excitedly. I have been trying to find you, but _ it was getting late, I decided to leave. He gave me the address of a _ near his home. Later that evening, I went to _ him there. I didn't dare to go _ , worrying this was some cheater. So Jack came along. After _ 10 km, we got to the coffee shop which Rhys _ . My _ were gone. Rhys was just a young boy. How did you _ my mum? I asked. He _ that when he found my mobile by the roadside, he started calling people in my list of contacts . But all they _ was my mobile phone number which didn't _ . He'd called many names, starting with the letter A. Finally he got Adam, one of my friends, who _ my house. I was _ to get my phone back with all the contacts, messages and photos I could have lost forever. I was so _ to Rhys and offered him so me money, but he _ . As we drove back, we praised Rhys for his honesty.
